thread.title: Vincent Lecavalier a healthy scratch for Flyers' season opener
thread.title_full: Vincent Lecavalier a healthy scratch for Flyers' season opener

author: Kirstie Chiappelli
title: Vincent Lecavalier a healthy scratch for Flyers' season opener
text:
Vincent Lecavalier a healthy scratch for Flyers' season opener Sporting News 20 hrs ago Kirstie Chiappelli © Eric Hartline-USA TODAY Sports Flyers center Vincent Lecavalier scored one goal and was a minus-2 in six preseason games. Vincent Lecavalier's season isn't off to the start he anticipated.
AdChoices The veteran Flyers center is a healthy scratch for Thursday's season opener against his former team, the Lightning, in Tampa, and he could miss playing time throughout the season.
MORE: Ranking the top 15 centers in the NHL | NHL season preview
Fellow center Sam Gagner and defenseman Luke Schenn are also slated to be sidelined for the opener.
“I really don’t know what to say,” Lecavalier said, via CSN Philly . “I’ll practice hard and be ready when they call me up.”
Despite scoring just one goal and being a minus-2 in six games, Lecavalier believes he played well in the preseason after being scratched 17 times last season. He entered training camp in top shape, though his skating was lacking.
Lecavalier, 35, spent his first 14 seasons with Tampa Bay before being bought out at the end of the 2012-13 season. He then signed a five-year, $22.5 million deal with Philadelphia. He tallied eight goals and 12 assists in 57 games last season.
